div.h1: Continued Closure of Schools for In-Person Instruction Through the End of the 2019-2020 School Year

span.span: The governor announced today the continued closure of schools for in-person instruction through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Remote learning will continue to take place through the remaining days of the school calendar.

While this is certainly not the news we were hoping to hear today, rest assured your teachers will make every effort to continue to provide learning opportunities for our students through digital platforms or traditional methods. We appreciate all of the help and support that parents have provided up to this point and ask for your continued support as your child completes this year’s learning opportunities. The last packet information went out on Monday, April 13 and all work is due no later than Friday, May 1. If your child has not received their packet, please contact the school office so we can make arrangements for pick-up. The next packet will go out on Monday, May 4. Also, just a reminder the next meal pick-up day is Monday, April 20 at the grade school from 11-12.

At this time, all events for May are being canceled. I know many of you are wondering about eighth grade and high school graduation. Please know, I will do everything possible to reschedule these events. Our students have worked very hard and deserve the recognition and honor of walking across the stage. In the interim, please take a drive through town and see our favorite seniors’ names posted on various light poles. A special thank you to Paul Pennington for hanging these signs for us.
As always, if you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact me. I will be sending out the final calendar next week.
